title: Boolean OR True Iff
description:
Prove the logical characterization of `orb`: the disjunction `orb a b` is `true` if and only if at least one of `a` or `b` is `true`.

**Goal:** `forall a b : bool, orb a b = true <-> a = true \/ b = true`

This requires handling both directions of `<->`, case analysis, and working with the `\/` (or) connective in Coq.
hints: Use `split` to handle each direction of the iff separately
Forward: use `destruct a; destruct b` — for each `true` case, choose `left` or `right`; for `false, false`, use `discriminate`
Backward: use `intros [Ha | Hb]` to case-split on the disjunction, then `rewrite` the hypothesis
prelude: (* No imports needed — bool, orb are in Coq's prelude *)
template:
Theorem orb_true_iff : forall a b : bool, orb a b = true <-> a = true \/ b = true.
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem orb_true_iff : forall a b : bool, orb a b = true <-> a = true \/ b = true.
Proof.
  intros a b. split.
  - intro H. destruct a; destruct b; simpl in H; try discriminate.
    + left. reflexivity.
    + left. reflexivity.
    + right. reflexivity.
  - intros [Ha | Hb].
    + rewrite Ha. simpl. reflexivity.
    + rewrite Hb. destruct a; simpl; reflexivity.
Qed.
